descriptions:
The BERRIES it
stores in its
vase-like shell decompose and
become a gooey
liquid.

It stores BERRIES
inside its shell.
To avoid attacks, it hides beneath
rocks and remains
completely still.

The fluid secreted
by its toes carves
holes in rocks for nesting and can be
mixed with BERRIES
to make a drink.

SHUCKLE quietly hides itself under
rocks, keeping its body concealed
inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away.
The berries mix with its body fluids to
become a juice.

become a juice.
